info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 6:34PM PDT until October 13 at 9:30PM PDT by NWS San Francisco CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, south central Santa Clara and southeastern Santa Cruz.
* WHEN...Until 930 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 634 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Santa Cruz, Watsonville, Gilroy, Morgan Hill, Corralitos, Scotts Valley, Capitola, Live Oak, Brown Valley Road, Eureka Canyon Road, Amesti, Freedom, Uvas Canyon Park, Rio Del Mar, Aptos, Interlaken, Soquel, Opal Cliffs and Twin Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Santa Clara, CA; Santa Cruz, CA
